snippet: LAWRENCE PHILLIPS, 21, pleaded no contest yesterday in El Monte, Calif., to a drunken driving charge resulting from a June 15 arrest, and the St. Louis Rams' running back was placed on probation for three years. The rookie was also fined $1,000 pl...
lead_paragraph: LAWRENCE PHILLIPS, 21, pleaded no contest yesterday in El Monte, Calif., to a drunken driving charge resulting from a June 15 arrest, and the St. Louis Rams' running back was placed on probation for three years. The rookie was also fined $1,000 plus penalty assessments -- a total of $2,900 -- and must serve 80 hours of community service. (AP)
abstract: St Louis Rams' running back Lawrence Phillips, 21, pleads no contest in El Monte, Calif, to drunken driving charge resulting from June 15 arrest; is placed on probation for three years, is fined, and sentenced to 80 hours of community service (S)
